lidavidm commented on issue #6207: ARROW-7551: [FlightRPC][C++] disable flaky Flight test
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6207#issuecomment-575648008
 
 
   I reproduced this locally with the Homebrew toolchain. I wonder if it isn't a bug in either the version of gRPC in Homebrew, or in the Homebrew build of gRPC.
   
   Note that there are _two_ definitions of the same gRPC symbol in both gRPC libraries! Also, note that `nm` shows that the same symbol is present in both gRPC libraries when built via Homebrew, but not a local build (albeit of a different version).
   
   ```
   (lldb) disas -n grpc_pollset_size
   libgrpc++.dylib`grpc_pollset_size:
       0x1048be3e1 <+0>:  pushq  %rbp
       0x1048be3e2 <+1>:  movq   %rsp, %rbp
       0x1048be3e5 <+4>:  movq   0x56c2c(%rip), %rax       ; grpc_pollset_impl
       0x1048be3ec <+11>: popq   %rbp
   ->  0x1048be3ed <+12>: jmpq   *0x38(%rax)
   
   libgrpc.dylib`grpc_pollset_size:
       0x104ac6335 <+0>:  pushq  %rbp
       0x104ac6336 <+1>:  movq   %rsp, %rbp
       0x104ac6339 <+4>:  movq   0xdf528(%rip), %rax       ; grpc_pollset_impl
       0x104ac6340 <+11>: popq   %rbp
       0x104ac6341 <+12>: jmpq   *0x38(%rax)
   
   (lldb) bt
   * thread #1, queue = 'com.apple.main-thread', stop reason = EXC_BAD_ACCESS (code=1, address=0x38)
     * frame #0: 0x00000001048be3ed libgrpc++.dylib`grpc_pollset_size() + 12
       frame #1: 0x00000001048d794a libgrpc++.dylib`grpc_completion_queue_create_internal(grpc_cq_completion_type, grpc_cq_polling_type, grpc_experimental_completion_queue_functor*) + 96
       frame #2: 0x000000010488f36d libgrpc++.dylib`___lldb_unnamed_symbol769$$libgrpc++.dylib + 81
       frame #3: 0x0000000104885350 libgrpc++.dylib`grpc_impl::ServerBuilder::BuildAndStart() + 1386
       frame #4: 0x0000000100c5bb2b libarrow_flight.100.dylib`arrow::flight::FlightServerBase::Init(this=0x0000000104e08e50, options=0x00007fff5fbfef40) at server.cc:690
       frame #5: 0x000000010004eaf5 arrow-flight-test`arrow::flight::TestFlightClient::SetUp(this=0x0000000104e0cbf0) at flight_test.cc:323
       frame #6: 0x00000001005ab3ce libgtest.dylib`void testing::internal::HandleSehExceptionsInMethodIfSupported<testing::Test, void>(testing::Test*, void (testing::Test::*)(), char const*) + 126
       frame #7: 0x00000001005570ab libgtest.dylib`void testing::internal::HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported<testing::Test, void>(testing::Test*, void (testing::Test::*)(), char const*) + 123
       frame #8: 0x0000000100556f84 libgtest.dylib`testing::Test::Run() + 116
       frame #9: 0x0000000100558a02 libgtest.dylib`testing::TestInfo::Run() + 210
       frame #10: 0x000000010055a25c libgtest.dylib`testing::TestCase::Run() + 236
       frame #11: 0x00000001005713d5 libgtest.dylib`testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests() + 869
       frame #12: 0x00000001005aee2e libgtest.dylib`bool testing::internal::HandleSehExceptionsInMethodIfSupported<testing::internal::UnitTestImpl, bool>(testing::internal::UnitTestImpl*, bool (testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::*)(), char const*) + 126
       frame #13: 0x0000000100570ddb libgtest.dylib`bool testing::internal::HandleExceptionsInMethodIfSupported<testing::internal::UnitTestImpl, bool>(testing::internal::UnitTestImpl*, bool (testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::*)(), char const*) + 123
       frame #14: 0x0000000100570c78 libgtest.dylib`testing::UnitTest::Run() + 408
       frame #15: 0x0000000100535f01 libgtest_main.dylib`RUN_ALL_TESTS() + 17
       frame #16: 0x0000000100535ee6 libgtest_main.dylib`main + 70
       frame #17: 0x00007fffc40aa235 libdyld.dylib`start + 1
   ```
   
   ```
   [09:26:26] lidavidm@Davids-MacBook-Pro /Users/lidavidm/Flight/grpc (0)
   > nm libs/opt/libgrpc++.dylib | grep grpc_pollset_size
   [09:26:38] lidavidm@Davids-MacBook-Pro /Users/lidavidm/Flight/grpc (1)
   > nm libs/opt/libgrpc.dylib | grep grpc_pollset_size
   00000000000186b0 T __Z17grpc_pollset_sizev
   [09:26:42] lidavidm@Davids-MacBook-Pro /Users/lidavidm/Flight/grpc (0)
   > nm /usr/local/lib/libgrpc++.dylib | grep grpc_pollset_size
   000000000005a3e1 T __Z17grpc_pollset_sizev
   [09:27:58] lidavidm@Davids-MacBook-Pro /Users/lidavidm/Flight/grpc (0)
   > nm /usr/local/lib/libgrpc.dylib | grep grpc_pollset_size
   0000000000015335 T __Z17grpc_pollset_sizev
   ```

lidavidm commented on issue #6207: ARROW-7551: [FlightRPC][C++] disable flaky Flight test
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6207#issuecomment-575658425
 
 
   Ok, it's definitely gRPC 1.26 is broken, and that's the version Homebrew ships. See https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/21662. 
   
   If this started happening around a month ago, that would also explain it. https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/commit/69c93eaafb3c546df56060e34896a59707c03b2b#diff-18d2a40da6dd2c4ea808274836fbcb2e

Running arrow-flight-test, redirecting output into /Users/runner/runners/2.163.1/work/arrow/arrow/build/cpp/build/test-logs/arrow-flight-test.txt (attempt 1/1)
Running main() from /Users/runner/runners/2.163.1/work/arrow/arrow/build/cpp/googletest_ep-prefix/src/googletest_ep/googletest/src/gtest_main.cc

It's not failing every time but I'm seeing it fail frequently.
fields.summary: [FlightRPC][C++] Flight test on macOS fails due to Homebrew gRPC

comments.body: I can't reproduce this so far on my MacOS machine. I'll have to do more digging to make sure I have the same environment as the test worker

If we can't reproduce this, should we skip this test for now on macOS/on CI? Right now it's just making all the builds fail, and that increases the risk that we'll merge a patch that really breaks things.
Yes, let's skip the test on CI for now.

backtrace from CI

{noformat}

I found this: https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/21587 Maybe we can try downgrading or upgrading gRPC.

-Ok - the issue is that we're both statically and dynamically linking gRPC. Interestingly this doesn't happen for me locally.-

The gRPC symbols in Flight dylibs are generated code, my mistake.

I configured GitHub to upload the artifacts, then pulled them down and examined them with otool and nm. https://github.com/lidavidm/arrow/commit/cd63e3046e65564b3021bc0c8275ba51257a7c75/checks?check_suite_id=405062849

Look at libarrow_flight.dylib:

{noformat}
> otool -L libarrow_flight.dylib
libarrow_flight.dylib:
	@rpath/libarrow_flight.100.dylib (compatibility version 100.0.0, current version 100.0.0)
	@rpath/libarrow.100.dylib (compatibility version 100.0.0, current version 100.0.0)

> nm libarrow_flight.dylib | rg grpc | head

{noformat}

We've run into this internally. IMO, we should only ever link gRPC dynamically. However, the official Python grpcio package needs to do the same, or else you'll get issues running both side by side (yet another problem we faced).

Argh, that is thorny. We are probably going to have to talk with the gRPC developers about this, since it stands to reason that more and more Python projects will utilize the C/C++ gRPC libraries as time goes on and run into this problem
